.
Adjusting an Award for Absences of Less Than 30 Days
Except as provided in
M21-1, Part X, Subpart iii, 1.D.4.e
, do
not
restore the Veteran’s full pension rate if the Veteran has not been discharged from VA-furnished hospitalization and has been absent less than 30 days, counting the day of departure, per
38 CFR 3.556(b)
.
Note
:  Current-law pension is not adjusted for inpatient hospital care at VA expense after January 31, 1990.  It is subject to reduction, however, for nursing home or domiciliary care.
References
:  For information on
restoring awards upon discharge, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart iii, 1.D.6
, and
adjustments in A&A cases, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart iii, 1.C
.
title: M21-1, Part X, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section D  - Adjusting Pension Under 38 CFR 3.551 and 3.556
